Description: Several small fragments of an undyed and dark brown cotton and wool textile (fabric type M) used as a wrapping. The weave is plain and weft-face. The spinning direction of warp and weft is 's'. The thread count is warp 4 per 10mm and weft 20 per10mm. The warp is cotton. Some wefts consist of 2 's'-spun, 'z'-plied elements. The textile was decorated with a band 20mm wide which may have been light purple in colour and now appears grey in colour.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p. 62)
Condition: Poor and very ragged. Much of the cotton warp has deteriorated leaving strings of weft.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.2.75 (excavation object cat. no.)
